Job Position: Operation Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Iyana-Offa, Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Operational Planning &amp; Management:


	Develop and implement operational strategies, policies, and procedures to achieve organizational objectives.
	Oversee daily business operations to ensure efficiency and quality standards are maintained.
	Monitor workflow, resource utilization, and process performance to identify areas for improvement.
	Coordinate with department heads to ensure alignment between operations and strategic goals.


Resource &amp; Process Management:


	Manage human, financial, and material resources to optimize productivity and cost efficiency.
	Implement process improvement initiatives such as lean management, automation, or digital tools.
	Ensure proper inventory management, logistics, and supply chain coordination (especially relevant in agricultural or production environments).


Performance Monitoring &amp; Reporting:


	Set operational performance targets and KPIs, and track progress regularly.
	Prepare and present periodic operational reports for management review.
	Analyze data to support decision-making and improve operational outcomes.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure operations comply with regulatory, safety, and environmental standards.
	Develop and enforce internal controls and risk mitigation measures.
	Maintain strong oversight of contracts, procurement, and vendor relationships.


Team Leadership &amp; Development:


	Supervise and mentor operational staff to enhance performance and accountability.
	Foster a culture of teamwork, continuous improvement, and innovation.
	Identify training needs and coordinate capacity-building programs for team members.


Stakeholder Management:


	Liaise with management, clients, suppliers, and external partners to ensure seamless operations.
	Represent the organization in meetings, negotiations, and project discussions.


Performance Indicators


	Achievement of operational and financial targets.
	Efficiency in resource utilization and cost reduction.
	Compliance with quality, safety, and regulatory standards.
	Employee productivity and satisfaction levels.
	Customer satisfaction and service delivery outcomes.


Qualifications and Experience


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Industrial Engineering, or a related field.
	Must have 3&ndash;5 years of progressive experience in operations management or a related role.
	Experience in the agricultural, manufacturing, or logistics sector is an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of budgeting, process optimization, and project management.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems.


Key Skills and Competencies:


	Strong leadership and decision-making abilities.
	Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
	Analytical mindset with attention to detail.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
	Strategic thinking and operational efficiency focus.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 / Month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@sahl.farm&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
